attributes.action: stop Sainsbury's from developing a supermarket in Bishops Waltham, a Medieval Market Town.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sainsbury's should not build their proposed 3,200 sqm supermarket, complete with coffee shop and 300 space car park.    
There will be a detrimental impact on this unique small town due to high volumes of traffic; a safety and environmental risk. 
The supermarket will take customers away from the local High Street, which is currently boasts small independent traders and brings customers in from the surrounding areas who will not visit the town centre as they will be offered free car parking and a coffee shop on site.
The aesthetic surroundings of the Palace Ruins and South Pond will be destroyed by this neon monster.
At a time when we should be encouraged to buy local and create a sustainable community Sainsbury's threatens this opportunity.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "stop Sainsbury's from developing a supermarket in Bishops Waltham, a Medieval Market Town."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20785


Prime Minister's Office
